physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features two ladies. Both of them are sitting down and looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. They are both wearing their ethnic costumes and holding one another's hands.
sgcool_label_text:
This studio portrait shows a seated nyonya tenderly holding the hands of her companion.  This photograph was probably taken by G.R. Lambert and Co.

G.R. Lambert and Co was a leading and the most enduring of the European photography studios in Singapore. The studio was established in 1867 by Gustave Richard Lambert, who was originally from Dresden, Germany. Popular among the elites, the firm was often chosen as the official photographers for important state events in Singapore. In 1861 it was appointed as the official photographer of the King of Siam and the Sultan of Johore.
